name: Sydney
hint: Australia's largest city, famous for its Opera House and Harbour Bridge

name: Melbourne
hint: Australia's cultural capital, known for coffee, sports, and street art

name: Brisbane
hint: Capital of Queensland, on Australia's subtropical east coast

name: Auckland
hint: Largest city in New Zealand, built on an isthmus between two harbors

name: Perth
hint: Capital of Western Australia, one of the most isolated major cities in the world

name: Wellington
hint: Capital of New Zealand, the world's southernmost capital of a sovereign state

name: Adelaide
hint: Capital of South Australia, known for wine regions and festivals

name: Canberra
hint: Capital of Australia, a planned city between Sydney and Melbourne

name: Port Moresby
hint: Capital of Papua New Guinea, on the southeastern coast

name: Suva
hint: Capital of Fiji, largest city in the South Pacific islands

name: Hobart
hint: Capital of Tasmania, Australia's second-oldest city

name: Darwin
hint: Capital of Australia's Northern Territory, gateway to Kakadu

name: Gold Coast
hint: Australian coastal city famous for its long sandy beaches and surfing

name: Christchurch
hint: Largest city in New Zealand's South Island, rebuilt after major earthquakes

name: Cairns
hint: Tropical city in far north Queensland, gateway to the Great Barrier Reef

name: Townsville
hint: North Queensland city on the coast, near Magnetic Island

name: Hamilton
hint: New Zealand's fourth-largest city, in the fertile Waikato region

name: Dunedin
hint: Scottish-influenced city in southern New Zealand, home to the world's steepest street

name: Lae
hint: Second-largest city in Papua New Guinea, a major industrial and port center

name: Nadi
hint: Fiji's tourism hub on the western coast of Viti Levu, home to the international airport

name: Apia
hint: Capital of Samoa, on the north coast of Upolu island

name: Nuku'alofa
hint: Capital of Tonga, located on the island of Tongatapu

name: Honiara
hint: Capital of the Solomon Islands, on the island of Guadalcanal

name: Port Vila
hint: Capital of Vanuatu, a popular cruise ship destination in the South Pacific

name: Noumea
hint: Capital of New Caledonia, a French territory with a stunning lagoon

name: Papeete
hint: Capital of French Polynesia, on the island of Tahiti

name: Wollongong
hint: Coastal city south of Sydney, between the Illawarra escarpment and the sea

name: Newcastle
hint: Major port city north of Sydney, at the mouth of the Hunter River

name: Geelong
hint: Victoria's second-largest city, on Corio Bay southwest of Melbourne

name: Tauranga
hint: Fastest-growing city in New Zealand, on the Bay of Plenty

name: Napier
hint: New Zealand city famous for its Art Deco architecture, rebuilt after a 1931 earthquake

name: Majuro
hint: Capital of the Marshall Islands, a coral atoll in the central Pacific

name: Tarawa
hint: Capital of Kiribati, a narrow atoll straddling the equator

name: Funafuti
hint: Capital of Tuvalu, one of the smallest and most remote capitals in the world

name: Launceston
hint: Second-largest city in Tasmania, at the junction of three rivers

name: Toowoomba
hint: Queensland's Garden City, perched on the edge of the Great Dividing Range

name: Alice Springs
hint: Outback town near the center of Australia, gateway to Uluru

name: Queenstown
hint: New Zealand's adventure capital on Lake Wakatipu, surrounded by the Remarkables

name: Rotorua
hint: New Zealand city famous for geothermal activity, geysers, and Maori culture

name: Hagåtña
hint: Capital of Guam, the largest city on the US territory in the western Pacific
